Mechanical design, automation and energy conversion are the cornerstones of this programme. Mechanical design begins with an idea, which is then shaped into a graphical design and executed into a finished product through a choice of materials, simulation, and production techniques. Automation describes a wide range of technologies that reduce human intervention and improve the overall efficiency of various engineering processes. Energy conversion comprises all aspects of energy efficiency in this process.
place Leuven (Group T)
school Master's
schedule 60 ECTS
language Fully taught in English, also available in Dutch
account_balance Faculty of Engineering Technology
Introduction to KU Leuven: webinars
Electromechanics sets the world in motion. In this programme, you will  learn to realise and control movements in machines and devices. During lectures and labs, you will learn about the state of the art in the field of hydraulic drives and servomotors, and also how to devise a creative concept and develop it into a usable design in accordance with current standards using powerful calculation software.
You can specialise in one of the following options:
Besides the specialisation option, you also have a unique opportunity to complement your programme with a dedicated focus. Within each focus you are getting acquainted with state-of-the-art technologies, methodologies and applications in a specific research area, making use of the renowned expertise of the different research groups over the different campuses of the Faculty of Engineering Technology.
The following focuses are offered:
The multi-purpose master's programme uses a modular structure and offers a maxium of flexibility and a variety of choices to define a high-quality education programme which is relevant for your future professional career.  All students will follow the same common part and will combine this with both their preferred option and focus.
Your programme
The Faculty of Engineering Technology has made a radical choice for an international orientation. Discover a wide range of possibilities to spend part of your study programme abroad, to take an internship or a summer school, even up to one year after graduation.
Going abroad
All students who did not obtain their previous degree at an institution of the Flemish Community, must submit an application via the Admissions office. Be sure to check out the specific admission requirements (diploma requirements, language requirements and possible additional requirements). The only way to know whether you can be admitted to any of our programmes is by applying and completing the application process.
Official and current admission requirements
For the most recent - and only official information - on application deadlines, check the application window for this programme.
Check the information on how to apply for this programme. There is also a  video that explains the application procedure from start to finish.
It is worth noting that our tuition fees are more affordable than many other leading universities thanks to generous government financing of higher education in Belgium. The fees for any individual student are contingent upon their academic programme and the nationality of the student.
For the most recent – and only official information – on the tuition fees, check the tuition fee calculator.
KU Leuven offers a variety of scholarships for qualifying students. Just as with our tuition fees, these scholarships may be contingent on a student’s academic programme or nationality, so be sure to thoroughly check eligibility requirements before applying.
This master’s programme opens up a whole spectrum of professional possibilities. Masters in Engineering Technology are active in the most diverse positions, sectors and professions all over the world. They are the engine of innovation in businesses and society. Depending on their interest, their engineering profile can range from technological expert to company manager.
Career perspectives
Our Student Career Center is happy to put you on the right track towards your first work experience, but also coaches you in the search for an interesting job and helps you with job interviews.
Student Career Center
KU Leuven Career Zone
For students wanting to start their own business, KU Leuven also has KICK, the KU Leuven community that encourages students with innovative and entrepreneurial ideas.
KU Leuven KICK
The Faculty of Engineering Technology constantly aims at strengthening the contacts between alumni as well as between alumni and current students.​​​​
Engineering alumni network
KU Leuven alumni
KU Leuven is one of Europe’s highest-ranked and most renowned universities. It boasts a long tradition of pioneering research and high-quality education. But KU Leuven has quite a few other strengths as well.
The city of Leuven is home to the main and largest KU Leuven campus.
Life at KU Leuven
This programme is organised by the Faculty of Engineering Technology, that offers full English-language programmes at 5 locations in Flanders.​​​​​​
Website of the Faculty of Engineering Technology

• Mechatronics - This option relates to designing, developing, and optimising automated mechanical machines. Supported by a strong background in electricity and mechanics, you dive more deeply into aspects such as advanced design methods, electronic operations, controls, measures and drives, data communication, and visualisation methods.
• Management - This option provides a broad introduction into contemporary management theory and practice. You define and compare key aspects, basic concepts and approaches in management and strategy and are able to analyse and interpret the complexity of managing an enterprise/organisation.
• Clinical Engineering
• Advanced Robotics
• Ecotechnologies
• Automotive Engineering
• Digital and Lightweight Manufacturing
• You are fascinated by science and technology and you want to put your theoretical knowledge into practice.
• You are innovative, creative and entrepreneurial.
• You want to work on innovation and optimisation processes and you want to contribute to the products and processes of the future.
• You want to learn how to optimally use materials to produce reliable components, how to make these components work together in ingenious mechanisms, how to drive these machines energy-efficiently and how to control them into fully automatic smart systems.
• Sustainability, safety and respect for the environment are important values to you.

Mechanical design begins with an idea, which is then shaped into a graphical design and executed into a finished product through a choice of materials, simulation, and production techniques. Introduction to KU Leuven: webinars
About the programme
Electromechanics sets the world in motion. In this programme, you will  learn to realise and control movements in machines and devices. During lectures and labs, you will learn about the state of the art in the field of hydraulic drives and servomotors, and also how to devise a creative concept and develop it into a usable design in accordance with current standards using powerful calculation software.
You can specialise in one of the following options:

Mechatronics - This option relates to designing, developing, and optimising automated mechanical machines. Supported by a strong background in electricity and mechanics, you dive more deeply into aspects such as advanced design methods, electronic operations, controls, measures and drives, data communication, and visualisation methods.
Management - This option provides a broad introduction into contemporary management theory and practice. You define and compare key aspects, basic concepts and approaches in management and strategy and are able to analyse and interpret the complexity of managing an enterprise/organisation.

Besides the specialisation option, you also have a unique opportunity to complement your programme with a dedicated focus. Within each focus you are getting acquainted with state-of-the-art technologies, methodologies and applications in a specific research area, making use of the renowned expertise of the different research groups over the different campuses of the Faculty of Engineering Technology.
The following focuses are offered:

Clinical Engineering 
Advanced Robotics
Ecotechnologies 
Automotive Engineering
Digital and Lightweight Manufacturing


 

Programme Master of Electromechanical Engineering Technology
The multi-purpose master's programme uses a modular structure and offers a maxium of flexibility and a variety of choices to define a high-quality education programme which is relevant for your future professional career.  All students will follow the same common part and will combine this with both their preferred option and focus.
Your programme  




Study abroad 
The Faculty of Engineering Technology has made a radical choice for an international orientation. Discover a wide range of possibilities to spend part of your study programme abroad, to take an internship or a summer school, even up to one year after graduation.
Going abroad




Admission and application


Admission requirements
All students who did not obtain their previous degree at an institution of the Flemish Community, must submit an application via the Admissions office. Be sure to check out the specific admission requirements (diploma requirements, language requirements and possible additional requirements). The only way to know whether you can be admitted to any of our programmes is by applying and completing the application process. 
Official and current admission requirements
Student profile

You are fascinated by science and technology and you want to put your theoretical knowledge into practice.
You are innovative, creative and entrepreneurial.
You want to work on innovation and optimisation processes and you want to contribute to the products and processes of the future.
You want to learn how to optimally use materials to produce reliable components, how to make these components work together in ingenious mechanisms, how to drive these machines energy-efficiently and how to control them into fully automatic smart systems.
Sustainability, safety and respect for the environment are important values to you.

Application window
For the most recent - and only official information - on application deadlines, check the application window for this programme. 
Application procedure
Check the information on how to apply for this programme. There is also a  video that explains the application procedure from start to finish.   


Tuition fees


Tuition fees
It is worth noting that our tuition fees are more affordable than many other leading universities thanks to generous government financing of higher education in Belgium. The fees for any individual student are contingent upon their academic programme and the nationality of the student.  
For the most recent – and only official information – on the tuition fees, check the tuition fee calculator. 
Scholarships
KU Leuven offers a variety of scholarships for qualifying students. Just as with our tuition fees, these scholarships may be contingent on a student’s academic programme or nationality, so be sure to thoroughly check eligibility requirements before applying. 


After graduation



 

Career perspectives
This master’s programme opens up a whole spectrum of professional possibilities. Masters in Engineering Technology are active in the most diverse positions, sectors and professions all over the world. They are the engine of innovation in businesses and society. Depending on their interest, their engineering profile can range from technological expert to company manager.
Career perspectives






Career support
Our Student Career Center is happy to put you on the right track towards your first work experience, but also coaches you in the search for an interesting job and helps you with job interviews. 


Student Career Center


KU Leuven Career Zone








Entrepreneurship
For students wanting to start their own business, KU Leuven also has KICK, the KU Leuven community that encourages students with innovative and entrepreneurial ideas.

Mechatronics - This option relates to designing, developing, and optimising automated mechanical machines. Supported by a strong background in electricity and mechanics, you dive more deeply into aspects such as advanced design methods, electronic operations, controls, measures and drives, data communication, and visualisation methods.
Management - This option provides a broad introduction into contemporary management theory and practice. You define and compare key aspects, basic concepts and approaches in management and strategy and are able to analyse and interpret the complexity of managing an enterprise/organisation.

Besides the specialisation option, you also have a unique opportunity to complement your programme with a dedicated focus. Within each focus you are getting acquainted with state-of-the-art technologies, methodologies and applications in a specific research area, making use of the renowned expertise of the different research groups over the different campuses of the Faculty of Engineering Technology.
The following focuses are offered:

Clinical Engineering 
Advanced Robotics
Ecotechnologies 
Automotive Engineering
Digital and Lightweight Manufacturing


 

Programme Master of Electromechanical Engineering Technology
The multi-purpose master's programme uses a modular structure and offers a maxium of flexibility and a variety of choices to define a high-quality education programme which is relevant for your future professional career.  All students will follow the same common part and will combine this with both their preferred option and focus.
Your programme  




Study abroad 
The Faculty of Engineering Technology has made a radical choice for an international orientation. Discover a wide range of possibilities to spend part of your study programme abroad, to take an internship or a summer school, even up to one year after graduation.
Going abroad




Admission and application


Admission requirements
All students who did not obtain their previous degree at an institution of the Flemish Community, must submit an application via the Admissions office. Be sure to check out the specific admission requirements (diploma requirements, language requirements and possible additional requirements). The only way to know whether you can be admitted to any of our programmes is by applying and completing the application process. 
Official and current admission requirements
Student profile

You are fascinated by science and technology and you want to put your theoretical knowledge into practice.
You are innovative, creative and entrepreneurial.
You want to work on innovation and optimisation processes and you want to contribute to the products and processes of the future.
You want to learn how to optimally use materials to produce reliable components, how to make these components work together in ingenious mechanisms, how to drive these machines energy-efficiently and how to control them into fully automatic smart systems.
Sustainability, safety and respect for the environment are important values to you.

Application window
For the most recent - and only official information - on application deadlines, check the application window for this programme. 
Application procedure
Check the information on how to apply for this programme. There is also a  video that explains the application procedure from start to finish.   


Tuition fees


Tuition fees
It is worth noting that our tuition fees are more affordable than many other leading universities thanks to generous government financing of higher education in Belgium. The fees for any individual student are contingent upon their academic programme and the nationality of the student.  
For the most recent – and only official information – on the tuition fees, check the tuition fee calculator. 
Scholarships
KU Leuven offers a variety of scholarships for qualifying students. Just as with our tuition fees, these scholarships may be contingent on a student’s academic programme or nationality, so be sure to thoroughly check eligibility requirements before applying. 


After graduation



 

Career perspectives
This master’s programme opens up a whole spectrum of professional possibilities. Masters in Engineering Technology are active in the most diverse positions, sectors and professions all over the world. They are the engine of innovation in businesses and society. Depending on their interest, their engineering profile can range from technological expert to company manager.
Career perspectives






Career support
Our Student Career Center is happy to put you on the right track towards your first work experience, but also coaches you in the search for an interesting job and helps you with job interviews. 


Student Career Center

About the programme
Electromechanics sets the world in motion. In this programme, you will  learn to realise and control movements in machines and devices. During lectures and labs, you will learn about the state of the art in the field of hydraulic drives and servomotors, and also how to devise a creative concept and develop it into a usable design in accordance with current standards using powerful calculation software.
You can specialise in one of the following options:

Mechatronics - This option relates to designing, developing, and optimising automated mechanical machines. Supported by a strong background in electricity and mechanics, you dive more deeply into aspects such as advanced design methods, electronic operations, controls, measures and drives, data communication, and visualisation methods.

Master of Electromechanical Engineering Technology
Mechanical design, automation and energy conversion are the cornerstones of this programme. Mechanical design begins with an idea, which is then shaped into a graphical design and executed into a finished product through a choice of materials, simulation, and production techniques. Automation describes a wide range of technologies that reduce human intervention and improve the overall efficiency of various engineering processes. Energy conversion comprises all aspects of energy efficiency in this process.

60 ECTS credits
language
                        English
account_balance
                        Faculty of Engineering Technology
On the basis of the following degrees, or similar degrees, obtained at an institution of the Flemish Community:
Bachelor in de industriële wetenschappen (Diepenbeek) (Afstudeerrichting elektromechanica)
(These programmes are only available in Dutch)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Brugge)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Geel)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Gent)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Leuven) (only students who had already started the bridging programme in 2021-2022)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Sint-Katelijne-Waver)
Students with an academic degree may contact the programme coordinator of the campus to have their eligibility for a preparatory programme considered.
Students who did not obtain their previous degree(s) at an institution of the Flemish Community should apply to the Admissions Office: https://www.kuleuven.be/english/application/.You can find a list of core documents, which should be submitted with every application, here: https://www.kuleuven.be/english/application/requesteddocuments.
To be eligible and to ensure an optimal match with the programme, the following admission criteria apply: - being a holder of an honours bachelor’s degree (B.Sc., B.Tech., B.Eng., etc.) or master's degree in a related/cognate subject area - having a clear affinity with the major - having a solid background in science and mathematics
All applicants must prove their proficiency in English. The only accepted English proficiency tests are: - TOEFL: internet-based test (iBT) 85 (min. subscores 20) - IELTS Academic certificate: 6.5 (min. subscores 6) - Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE) or Cambridge English: Proficiency (CPE) exam: 176 (min. subscores 169) Exempted from submitting an English proficiency certificate are: - Applicants who have already obtained a diploma (secondary or higher education) taught in English in Australia, English-speaking Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and the United States of America; - Applicants with a diploma of secondary education issued by the Flemish Community.
We strongly encourage our applicants to submit a GRE test as it can be an asset to the overall evaluation of their application, although it is not mandatory.
Application evaluationAll applications will be reviewed by the Admissions Office of KU Leuven (phase 1) and the Board of Admissions of the master programme (phase 2). The Board of Admissions carefully considers all applicants who have provided all required documents. If the Board of Admissions evaluates the application file positively (which means they are convinced that there is compatibility between the master’s programme and the educational background of the applicant), the applicant will be granted direct access to the master’s programme. If the Board of Admissions evaluates the application as promising and relevant to the programme, but thinks important elements are still missing in the educational background and level of the applicant, the applicant will be eligible to start a preparatory programme. After successfully completing the preparatory programme, the applicant will be granted direct access to the master's programme. Since the master's programme's duration is only one year (60 ECTS), there is no room to introduce courses to bridge with the undergraduate programme the candidate has already completed. Therefore most applicants need to follow a preparatory programme. If the Board of Admissions evaluates the educational background as not suitable to guarantee a good continuation of the programme and/or the level/academic excellency as insufficient, the application will be rejected. Application deadlines For application deadlines, click here. Please note that these dates will be applied strictly. All requested documents must be submitted through the online application system before the deadline in order to be eligible  (https://www.kuleuven.be/english/application/instructions).

After bridging programme
(These programmes are only available in Dutch)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Brugge)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Geel)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Gent)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Leuven) (only students who had already started the bridging programme in 2021-2022)Schakelprogramma: Master in de industriële wetenschappen: elektromechanica (Sint-Katelijne-Waver)

After preparatory programme
Students with an academic degree may contact the programme coordinator of the campus to have their eligibility for a preparatory programme considered.
[CARD]
Students with a degree obtained at an institution of the Flemish Community
[CARD]
Students who did not obtain their previous degree(s) at an institution of the Flemish Community should apply to the Admissions Office: https://www.kuleuven.be/english/application/.You can find a list of core documents, which should be submitted with every application, here: https://www.kuleuven.be/english/application/requesteddocuments.
Diploma requirements
To be eligible and to ensure an optimal match with the programme, the following admission criteria apply: - being a holder of an honours bachelor’s degree (B.Sc., B.Tech., B.Eng., etc.) or master's degree in a related/cognate subject area - having a clear affinity with the major - having a solid background in science and mathematics
Language requirements
All applicants must prove their proficiency in English. The only accepted English proficiency tests are: - TOEFL: internet-based test (iBT) 85 (min. subscores 20) - IELTS Academic certificate: 6.5 (min. subscores 6) - Cambridge English: Advanced (CAE) or Cambridge English: Proficiency (CPE) exam: 176 (min. subscores 169) Exempted from submitting an English proficiency certificate are: - Applicants who have already obtained a diploma (secondary or higher education) taught in English in Australia, English-speaking Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and the United States of America; - Applicants with a diploma of secondary education issued by the Flemish Community.
Additional requirements
We strongly encourage our applicants to submit a GRE test as it can be an asset to the overall evaluation of their application, although it is not mandatory.
Additional information
Application evaluationAll applications will be reviewed by the Admissions Office of KU Leuven (phase 1) and the Board of Admissions of the master programme (phase 2). The Board of Admissions carefully considers all applicants who have provided all required documents. If the Board of Admissions evaluates the application file positively (which means they are convinced that there is compatibility between the master’s programme and the educational background of the applicant), the applicant will be granted direct access to the master’s programme. If the Board of Admissions evaluates the application as promising and relevant to the programme, but thinks important elements are still missing in the educational background and level of the applicant, the applicant will be eligible to start a preparatory programme. After successfully completing the preparatory programme, the applicant will be granted direct access to the master's programme. Since the master's programme's duration is only one year (60 ECTS), there is no room to introduce courses to bridge with the undergraduate programme the candidate has already completed. Therefore most applicants need to follow a preparatory programme. If the Board of Admissions evaluates the educational background as not suitable to guarantee a good continuation of the programme and/or the level/academic excellency as insufficient, the application will be rejected. Application deadlines For application deadlines, click here. Please note that these dates will be applied strictly. All requested documents must be submitted through the online application system before the deadline in order to be eligible  (https://www.kuleuven.be/english/application/instructions).

[HEADING] Transition to the job market
During your education you will discover where your interests and strengths lie. After graduation, you will have built up knowledge and skills in various disciplines and you will be a knowledge expert within your field, giving you a wide range of career opportunities. What is certain is that you will have access to a very varied range of jobs in many sectors.
The companies are competing fiercely in an international market. That's why they need engineers. Lots of engineers. But not just any engineers. They are mainly looking for versatilety, entrepreneurial industrial engineers who can work not only with machines, but also with people, markets and money.
Industrial engineers can be found in all sectors (electronics, chemistry, construction to education and research) and in all functions: from research and development over production to marketing and sales. Many engineers put their knowledge and skills at the service of companies as consultants. At the same time, a growing number is opting for a doctorate.
Almost every industrial engineer who graduates today has international contacts.  But already one in four is effectively working abroad, a number that will increase as the economy and technology become more globalized and everything and everyone is connected.
There is no such thing as THE industrial engineer. The jobs are too different for that. You can make the choice considerably easier by knowing what type of engineer you are.
Discover your type!
Read testimonials from graduated industrial engineers on
www.ikbenindustrieelingenieur.be
(only in Dutch)
Can't wait to get your diploma in your hands? Are you ready to take the job market by storm? Your first 'real' job is not only an exciting, but also an important moment in your life. You are laying the foundations of your future career. In your search for that perfect job you can already call on a number of help lines.

[CARD]
Wanted: Engineer (m/f/x)
The companies are competing fiercely in an international market. That's why they need engineers. Lots of engineers. But not just any engineers. They are mainly looking for versatilety, entrepreneurial industrial engineers who can work not only with machines, but also with people, markets and money.
Industrial engineers can be found in all sectors (electronics, chemistry, construction to education and research) and in all functions: from research and development over production to marketing and sales. Many engineers put their knowledge and skills at the service of companies as consultants. At the same time, a growing number is opting for a doctorate.
Almost every industrial engineer who graduates today has international contacts.  But already one in four is effectively working abroad, a number that will increase as the economy and technology become more globalized and everything and everyone is connected.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Application window
Select the academic year, your nationality, and the programme of your choice to find out which application deadline applies to you.
Regardless of the deadline, we advise you to apply at your earliest convenience, as seats may fill up early for certain programmes and you may need additional time to apply for travel and study documents. To ensure your application is processed in time, we recommend you apply before:•  1 March for non-EEA citizens•  1 June for EEA citizens and non-EEA citizens with a valid Belgian residence permit 
The academic year 2025-2026 starts on 17 September 2025.
Select the academic year, your nationality, and the programme of your choice to find out which application deadline applies to you.
Regardless of the deadline, we advise you to apply at your earliest convenience, as seats may fill up early for certain programmes and you may need additional time to apply for travel and study documents. [HEADING] Master of Electromechanical Engineering Technology
[HEADING] Master of Science
[HEADING] Traject
school

home_storage

language

account_balance
                        Faculty of Engineering Technology
The Master’s programme of Electromechanical Engineering Technology offers six options: Automotive Engineering (De Nayer Campus), Aeronautical Engineering Technology (Bruges Campus), Management (Group T Leuven Campus), Mechatronics (Ghent Campus and Group T Leuven Campus), Design (Ghent Campus) and Design and Mechatronics (Bruges Campus, De Nayer Campus and Geel Campus). Students who wish to take an option that is not listed in the programme below, must enroll in the Master's programme at another campus.
All courses are mandatory.
Select one course from the list below. The numbers of participants for these courses are limited. As soon as the groups are full, the course can no longer be booked, so please as soon as possible indicate all events you want to take up and ensure whether the group you choose causes no overlap in your schedule. If one of the courses is full, you should choose another one.
Students choose one of the options from the list below.
The option Management can not be selected in combination with the focus Advanced Robotics.All courses are mandatory. Subject to motivation you can propose to replace the course D0S18A “Technology Entrepreneurship and New Business Development” with at least 6 credits of courses offered by KU Leuven at master's level. In this case, you must obtain permission from the coordinator of the course in question and the programme coordinator. Once you have gained permission, you can add the course to your ISP by entering it under "Free selection from the academic offering".
All courses are mandatory. Subject to motivation you can propose to replace the course T4PIT2 “Industrial IT” with another course offered by KU Leuven at master's level. In this case, you must obtain permission from the coordinator of the course in question and the programme coordinator. Once you have gained permission, you can add the course to your ISP by entering it under "Free selection from the academic offering".
Students choose one of the focusses from the list below.
The focus Advanced Robotics can only be selected in combination with the option Mechatronics. All courses are mandatory.
All courses are mandatory.
The focus Digital and Lightweight Manufacturing is offered on Group T Leuven Campus and De Nayer Campus. Students select in each semester 6 credits from the list below. For some of the course units students will have to commute to De Nayer Campus (YI1568 Welding and Joining Techniques; YI1569 Lightweight Materials and Design).
All courses are mandatory.
All courses are mandatory. The focus Automotive Engineering is offered at De Nayer Campus. Students taking up this focus must move to De Nayer Campus for these courses.
Students can exchange the course Engineer as a Professional (4 credits) for a course from the list below or for a short international course (IMMAII). The student submits his choice to the study track counsellor.The course IMMAII “International module master of engineering technology” can only be booked by the study track counsellor. Students can book it when they have successfully succeeded a short international course with assessment abroad and only if they applied for it in KU Loket and received approval from the programme coordinator before departure. Students have to contact their study track counsellor for booking it, and follow one of the following procedures: A. They register for this course with a credit contract. B. When there is a match between the content of the short international course and a course or subcourse of the regular master programme, they can apply to replace the regular course with the international course.
The courses below are intended as transitional measures for specific students. They can only be added to the ISP after approval by the study path adviser.
• Home
• Master of Electromechanical Engineering Technology (Leuven)

                                        Internship or Short International Course
                


Students can exchange the course Engineer as a Professional (4 credits) for a course from the list below or for a short international course (IMMAII). The student submits his choice to the study track counsellor.The course IMMAII “International module master of engineering technology” can only be booked by the study track counsellor. Students can book it when they have successfully succeeded a short international course with assessment abroad and only if they applied for it in KU Loket and received approval from the programme coordinator before departure. Students have to contact their study track counsellor for booking it, and follow one of the following procedures: A. They register for this course with a credit contract. B. When there is a match between the content of the short international course and a course or subcourse of the regular master programme, they can apply to replace the regular course with the international course.

                                        Internship or Short International Course
                


Students can exchange the course Engineer as a Professional (4 credits) for a course from the list below or for a short international course (IMMAII). The student submits his choice to the study track counsellor.The course IMMAII “International module master of engineering technology” can only be booked by the study track counsellor. Students can book it when they have successfully succeeded a short international course with assessment abroad and only if they applied for it in KU Loket and received approval from the programme coordinator before departure. Students have to contact their study track counsellor for booking it, and follow one of the following procedures: A. They register for this course with a credit contract. B. When there is a match between the content of the short international course and a course or subcourse of the regular master programme, they can apply to replace the regular course with the international course.

                                        Internship or Short International Course
                


Students can exchange the course Engineer as a Professional (4 credits) for a course from the list below or for a short international course (IMMAII). The student submits his choice to the study track counsellor.The course IMMAII “International module master of engineering technology” can only be booked by the study track counsellor. Students can book it when they have successfully succeeded a short international course with assessment abroad and only if they applied for it in KU Loket and received approval from the programme coordinator before departure. Students have to contact their study track counsellor for booking it, and follow one of the following procedures: A. They register for this course with a credit contract. B. When there is a match between the content of the short international course and a course or subcourse of the regular master programme, they can apply to replace the regular course with the international course.

pages.title: Master of Electromechanical Engineering Technology (Leuven) - Programme structure | KU Leuven

pages.content:
Upon enrolment, you receive an initial invoice for one academic year and based on 60 credits. 60 credits is the yearly standard amount of credits for most KU Leuven programmes. Please note this fee can differ between various programmes.
Here below, you can check the tuition fee for your particular situation for one academic year.
If you're obligated to enroll in a preparatory programme combined with your master programme, your intitial tuition fee will be based on a 60 credit calculation as well.
From mid-March onwards, tuition fees are recalculated based on the actual number of credits as approved in the Individual Study Programme (ISP). If you take up more or less than 60 credits, you may expect an additional invoice or a refund accordingly. More information about this subject can be found under 'Calculation'.
A separate fee calculation applies if you enroll for a combination of programmes, one of which is mentioned in the categories below:

Cost of living in Belgium
Tuition fee regulations
There might be scholarships and/or waivers available for you, please check the options here.
• advanced master programmes
• continuing education (including postgraduate programmes)
• doctoral programmes and other special registration categories

pages.content:
[HEADING] Prepare your application
[HEADING] Step-by-step guide to apply
[HEADING] Browse our programmes and get informed
[HEADING] Check admission requirements
[HEADING] Check the application window for your programme
[HEADING] Check the tuition fees and scholarship options for your programme
[HEADING] Collect the requested documents
[HEADING] Start your application
[HEADING] Exchange students
[HEADING] Credit contract
[HEADING] PhD students
[HEADING] Need help?
Interested in studying at KU Leuven?
This brief guide will explain all major steps you need to take to prepare your application in case you do not have a Flemish degree that gives direct access to your desired programme. Make sure you check all steps: it will significantly improve your chances to get admitted.
We look forward to receiving your application!
This guide will help you prepare your application if you wish to pursue a bachelor, master, advanced master or postgraduate studies at KU Leuven. There are different procedures for exchange students, PhD students or credit contracts.
For degree seeking students:
Every programme at KU Leuven has its own entry requirements, application procedure and deadlines. Please always consult the conditions specifically for your programme of interest.
First check whether KU Leuven offers any of the programmes you might be interested in. Our programme pages will give you details about the programme courses, further career opportunities and the student profile they're looking for.
Even with all the relevant information at hand, choosing a university can be a daunting task. Our international team is here to help you with a wide range of online presentations. You might even be able to meet us in your own country at one of the study abroad information fairs we attend.
Every KU Leuven programme has their own admission requirements. Make sure to read the detailed admission requirements of the specific study programmes available at the various KU Leuven campuses, to see if you are eligible.
Check the admission requirements
Search for your programme, click on 'admission requirements' and then select the admission requirements for the year that you would like to start your studies.
It is not possible to transfer into a programme at KU Leuven. Applicants interested in transferring must apply as a new student via the regular application procedure.
Our admissions process works on a rolling basis, but apply in time to start in the following academic year.
Some English programmes have a fixed deadline. You can check the specific deadline of your programme by using our application window tool.
For our Dutch programmes, there is a fixed deadline of February 1 for non-EEA applicants. For EEA applicants, there is no fixed deadline.
You can check the tuition fee and scholarship options for your programme using our tuition fee calculator and scholarships database.
All programmes request the same core documents. The additional documents depend on the programme you wish to apply for and can be consulted in the admission requirements.
To start your application at KU Leuven, log in to the web app via your browser and complete your personal data, upload the required documents and pay the application fee.
Application instructions
In general, it is not possible to submit an application for a diploma contract with the intention to start in the second semester. All students start the academic year in September. The only exception is the Preparatory programme for the Master of Rehabilitation Sciences and Physiotherapy, which always starts in February. All of our programmes are taught full time and during the day. We do not offer evening or weekend classes.
Check out the academic calendar
Exchange students remain enrolled at their home university while spending a few months to a full academic year at KU Leuven, free of charge. They take part in one of the European Commission’s educational programmes, such as Erasmus+. Others are visiting Leuven in the framework of an exchange agreement at faculty level between their home university and KU Leuven.
Apply as an exchange student
Some students just want to register for one or more course units, with the intention of obtaining a credit certificate instead of a full degree.
In their education regulations, the faculties determine what possible course credits can or cannot qualify for a credit contract.
Apply for a credit contract
You can start a PhD at KU Leuven either by applying for a vacant position or by finding a supervisor and writing your own research proposal.
Either way requires you to get a formal approval and invitation by your future supervisor.
Apply as a PhD student
Do you have questions or are you encountering any issues? Do not hesitate to reach out for help.
• Step 1: Browse our programmes and get informed
• Step 2: Check the admission requirements
• Step 3: Check the application window
• Step 4: Check the tuition fees and scholarship options for your programme
• Step 5: Collect the requested documents
• Step 6: Start your application
• Check our list of degree programmes
• Check our postgraduate certificates and continuing studies
• Join one of our webinars
• Meet us abroad
• Tuition fee calculator
• Scholarships database
• Application for a Bachelor's programme
• Application for a Master's , Advanced Master's or postgraduate programme

Step 2: Check the admission requirements
Step 3: Check the application window
Step 4: Check the tuition fees and scholarship options for your programme
Step 5: Collect the requested documents
Step 6: Start your application

Every programme at KU Leuven has its own entry requirements, application procedure and deadlines. Please always consult the conditions specifically for your programme of interest.






 




1

Browse our programmes and get informed
First check whether KU Leuven offers any of the programmes you might be interested in. Our programme pages will give you details about the programme courses, further career opportunities and the student profile they're looking for. 
Even with all the relevant information at hand, choosing a university can be a daunting task. Our international team is here to help you with a wide range of online presentations. You might even be able to meet us in your own country at one of the study abroad information fairs we attend. 

Check our list of degree programmes
Check our postgraduate certificates and continuing studies
Join one of our webinars
Meet us abroad










 




2

Check admission requirements
Every KU Leuven programme has their own admission requirements. Make sure to read the detailed admission requirements of the specific study programmes available at the various KU Leuven campuses, to see if you are eligible. 
Check the admission requirements
Search for your programme, click on 'admission requirements' and then select the admission requirements for the year that you would like to start your studies.
It is not possible to transfer into a programme at KU Leuven. Applicants interested in transferring must apply as a new student via the regular application procedure.









 




3

Check the application window for your programme
Our admissions process works on a rolling basis, but apply in time to start in the following academic year.
Some English programmes have a fixed deadline. You can check the specific deadline of your programme by using our application window tool.
For our Dutch programmes, there is a fixed deadline of February 1 for non-EEA applicants. For EEA applicants, there is no fixed deadline.









 




4

Check the tuition fees and scholarship options for your programme
You can check the tuition fee and scholarship options for your programme using our tuition fee calculator and scholarships database.

Tuition fee calculator
Scholarships database










 




5

Collect the requested documents
All programmes request the same core documents. The additional documents depend on the programme you wish to apply for and can be consulted in the admission requirements.

Application for a Bachelor's programme
Application for a Master's , Advanced Master's or postgraduate programme










 




6

Start your application
To start your application at KU Leuven, log in to the web app via your browser and complete your personal data, upload the required documents and pay the application fee.
Application instructions







In general, it is not possible to submit an application for a diploma contract with the intention to start in the second semester. All students start the academic year in September. The only exception is the Preparatory programme for the Master of Rehabilitation Sciences and Physiotherapy, which always starts in February. All of our programmes are taught full time and during the day. We do not offer evening or weekend classes.
Check out the academic calendar


 






Exchange students
Exchange students remain enrolled at their home university while spending a few months to a full academic year at KU Leuven, free of charge. They take part in one of the European Commission’s educational programmes, such as Erasmus+. Others are visiting Leuven in the framework of an exchange agreement at faculty level between their home university and KU Leuven.
Apply as an exchange student






Credit contract
Some students just want to register for one or more course units, with the intention of obtaining a credit certificate instead of a full degree.
In their education regulations, the faculties determine what possible course credits can or cannot qualify for a credit contract.
Apply for a credit contract






PhD students
You can start a PhD at KU Leuven either by applying for a vacant position or by finding a supervisor and writing your own research proposal.
Either way requires you to get a formal approval and invitation by your future supervisor. 
Apply as a PhD student






 

Need help?
Do you have questions or are you encountering any issues? Do not hesitate to reach out for help.
Contact us
Prepare your application
Interested in studying at KU Leuven?
This brief guide will explain all major steps you need to take to prepare your application in case you do not have a Flemish degree that gives direct access to your desired programme. Make sure you check all steps: it will significantly improve your chances to get admitted.
We look forward to receiving your application!

pages.title: Apply to KU Leuven — Applications

pages.content:
[HEADING] How to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder
[HEADING] Flemish degree holder
[HEADING] Dutch degree holder
[HEADING] Exceptions for Flemish degree holders
[HEADING] Others
[HEADING] Contact
You’ve made your choice for one of our programmes and want to apply. Great news! There are a few steps you need to take to start your application and the admission process at our university. The process will depend on if you've obtained your secondary education and/or previous degree(s) in the Flemish Community (Belgium) or not.
In case you did not obtain your previous degree(s) at an institution of the Flemish Community, you need to go through an admission process before you can register for a KU Leuven programme.
Apply as non-Flemish degree holder
Students who obtained a degree at an institution of the Flemish Community, can get direct access to their desired programme if their degree matches the intended study level. A secondary school degree gives access to the bachelor's programmes, the bachelor's degrees to the master's programmes.
If you are interested in the Bachelor of Business Engineering, the Bachelor of European Studies, or the Bachelor of Laws, then you will need to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder.
Register as Flemish degree holder
If you hold a Dutch VWO diploma ('voorbereidend wetenschappelijk onderwijs') and are interested in a bachelor's programme at KU Leuven, you have to follow the procedure for students with a degree obtained at an institution of the Flemish Community.
Information for Dutch degree holders (in Dutch)
If you hold another type of Dutch diploma, you have to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder.
Not all Flemish diplomas can be consulted via the Flemish learning and experience database (LED). This means that if your diploma is mentioned on the list, you must submit an application via Admissions to check wheter you can be admitted to the programme of your choice based on the diploma you have obtained.
Check out the list
For students who do not hold a secondary education diploma and want to study a bachelor's programme in Dutch or for strong students  in their final year of secondary education there are different procedures in place.
The KU Leuven Admissions Office functions as the contact, advice, expertise and administrative centre for KU Leuven and its Association with respect to the admission of students with a previous non-Flemish diploma.
• Procedure to register for a bachelor's degree in Dutch without a secondary education diploma (in Dutch)
• Project for cognitively strong  students in secondary school (in Dutch)
[GRID_TABLE]

How to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder

If you are interested in the Bachelor of Business Engineering, the Bachelor of European Studies, or the Bachelor of Laws, then you will need to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder. 
Information for Dutch degree holders (in Dutch)
If you hold another type of Dutch diploma, you have to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder.








Exceptions for Flemish degree holders
Not all Flemish diplomas can be consulted via the Flemish learning and experience database (LED). This means that if your diploma is mentioned on the list, you must submit an application via Admissions to check wheter you can be admitted to the programme of your choice based on the diploma you have obtained.
Check out the list






Others
For students who do not hold a secondary education diploma and want to study a bachelor's programme in Dutch or for strong students  in their final year of secondary education there are different procedures in place.

Contact
The KU Leuven Admissions Office functions as the contact, advice, expertise and administrative centre for KU Leuven and its Association with respect to the admission of students with a previous non-Flemish diploma.

If you are interested in the Bachelor of Business Engineering, the Bachelor of European Studies, or the Bachelor of Laws, then you will need to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder. 
Register as Flemish degree holder






Dutch degree holder
If you hold a Dutch VWO diploma ('voorbereidend wetenschappelijk onderwijs') and are interested in a bachelor's programme at KU Leuven, you have to follow the procedure for students with a degree obtained at an institution of the Flemish Community.
If you are interested in the Bachelor of Business Engineering, the Bachelor of European Studies, or the Bachelor of Laws, then you will need to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder. 
Information for Dutch degree holders (in Dutch)
If you hold another type of Dutch diploma, you have to apply as a non-Flemish degree holder.








Exceptions for Flemish degree holders
Not all Flemish diplomas can be consulted via the Flemish learning and experience database (LED). This means that if your diploma is mentioned on the list, you must submit an application via Admissions to check wheter you can be admitted to the programme of your choice based on the diploma you have obtained.
Check out the list






Others
For students who do not hold a secondary education diploma and want to study a bachelor's programme in Dutch or for strong students  in their final year of secondary education there are different procedures in place.

Procedure to register for a bachelor's degree in Dutch without a secondary education diploma (in Dutch)
Project for cognitively strong  students in secondary school (in Dutch)






 

Contact
The KU Leuven Admissions Office functions as the contact, advice, expertise and administrative centre for KU Leuven and its Association with respect to the admission of students with a previous non-Flemish diploma.
Contact us

pages.content:
[HEADING] On KU Leuven Career Zone
[HEADING] Want to get everything out of KU Leuven Career Zone?
[HEADING] Through your student association or faculty
[HEADING] For employers
Find your student job, volunteer work, internship or entry-level job on KU Leuven Career Zone
Use KU Leuven Career Zone on your phone too!
Find your job
KU Leuven Career Zone is always accessible, from the start of your studies up to two years after graduation. The platform is open to all KU Leuven students and PhD students on all campuses, as well as to students at UCLL (Leuven-Diest) and LUCA School of Arts Lemmens Campus looking for a student job.
Discover our tips & tricks
Testimonial Benjamin
Looking for a job related to your specialisation? Student associations and faculties often offer specific internships and entry-level jobs.
They also provide lots of information on opportunities after graduation, career paths and the alumni network.
Do you want to advertise jobs to students or recent graduates?
Discover the options for employers
• Flexibly filter according to your preferences
• Search the extensive database for jobs in Belgium and abroad
• Find a job that suits you
• Attend job events
• Check out the opportunities for graduating students and alumni
• Find your faculty's internship website (overview in Dutch)
